result.execSummary:
All charges against Eric R. Busarow in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric R. Busarow is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Eric R. Busarow appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared in court for Eric R. Busarow. Calling 21CF311 & 22CF16. 22CF16 set for an adjourned initial appearance. Magallones will be representing - there is a resolution- would like to conduct a waiver of preliminary hearing/plea and sentencing at same time. Court will set out. Defendant would like to appear in person at next hearing. Bond continued. adj. 03:21 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Eric R. Busarow appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Pfeifer statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on employment. Defendant statement to bond. Court sets bond. adj. 01:30 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
